main event: On July 3, 1949, a civilian in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, observed an unidentified flying object described as being 500ft long, 50ft high, with 3 or 4 windows emitting a bright light and trailing a 100ft long cherry-red tail of fire. The object traveled at a great rate of speed from south to north, disappearing within 10-15 seconds.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 500ft long and 50ft high.
It had 3 or 4 windows emitting a very bright light and trailed a 100ft long cherry-red tail of fire.
The object was observed from a distance of about 5 miles, at an angle of 40-45 degrees, possibly at an altitude of 2 miles.
The witness reported the sighting to Dr. Draper of the Buhl Planetarium & Institute in Pittsburgh, who had no prior reports of the ship.
The sighting is documented in a letter to the Technical Intelligence Division at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, expressing the witness's honesty and requesting correspondence on the matter.
